name: NH Utrecht

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel in the centre of Utrecht near to the central station and the Jaarbeurs on walking distance of the lovely and old centre of Utrecht.
reviews.title: Centre of Utrecht

reviews.text: Because we were celebrating our weddingday a lot of years ago our room was spontaneously upgraded to a lovely big room; a very nice gesture.
reviews.title: Comfortable, central location

reviews.text: The only negative point is that the hotel show as facility a parking; this parking is nearest to the hotel but is not from the hotel and 24 h parking has be paid with 24 Euro. We believe it should be mentioned.
reviews.title: perfect to visit the Jaarbeurs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the fourth time in 8 months that I chose NH Utrecht. It made me - a foreigner, a stranger in an unknown land - feel so much at home that I fell in love with the hotel and the city. My best experiences - (1) bang outside the station - did you know Utrecht is the busiest train station at Netherlends due to its central location (2) 50m from the bus station and tram station - connects to everywhere (3) so near the shops and restaurants that are a man and womans delight - I found my love thanks to NH (4) fantastic buffet breakfast and dinner - they know that the way to a mans heart is through his stomach (5) well trained front desk who are so polite and organised..In short, WOW WOW WOW
reviews.title: lovely!

reviews.text: Hotel is in quite an old building, rooms are large but they can use an update.
reviews.title: Second Home

reviews.text: Average business people hotel. Location is perfect. 2 min. walk to the train station and city centre. Rooms can use a lick of paint, new wall paper and a new bathroom. They still have shower curtains. And everything gets wet while having a shower. Also mold in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Worn out rooms, nice food

reviews.text: High floor rooms have a good view. Rooms are very large.
reviews.title: We like this hotel very much, and we often stay here.

reviews.text: Food was good.
reviews.title: Not a bad place

reviews.text: The rooms are nice and clean and practical. The breakfast very delicious. The staff is very friendly and helps you in any possible way.The hotel has got a nice restaurant and bar. It is easy to get there from Shiphol and close to the railwaystation.
reviews.title: Superb city break!

reviews.text: Stayed here July 26 and 27, 2011 in a room for 3. Third bed was pull out couch which was fairly uncomfortable. Room was good sized by European standards and hotel was clean with very friendly and helpful staff. Very good location outside of train station and short walk from city center. Internet access in your room must be purchased at something like 13 Euros for 24 hours - extemely expensive. Free in lobby but only 30 minutes at a time. Rather expensive option for value in return.
reviews.title: Looking for somewhere great to stay in Utrecht, this is it.

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in December 2011. We got upgraded to the suites which was a nice touch. Overall the hotel is ok, not luxury. Breakfast is good, bar staff a bit slow, whereas front office staff were helpful and polite. There are better hotels out there but definitely much worse ones too!
reviews.title: Ok stay for Business

reviews.text: The only plus point for this hotel is that it is in city centre and close to the railway station. The hotel is very old and rooms are showing the signs of ages.
reviews.title: Needs renovation urgently

reviews.text: Check in: As i reached at around 11:30 am, I had to wait for 3 hours before i got the room.
reviews.title: Terrible service, average rooms

reviews.text: Room: I guess all the rooms in this hotel are very old and same is true with its furnishing. Bathrooms were small, but clean. Internet was complimentary due to my company tie up with hotel, otherwise it is quite expensive.
reviews.title: Not a great hotel at all

reviews.text: Breakfast: It could have been better for sure. Nothing great to mention about it. Food quality was good
reviews.title: Awesome experience

reviews.text: On Day one I stayed in room 1305. After long flight what i see is, water leakage from 14th floors Air-Conditioner. The Staff immediately changed my room to 1203. Even in this room, the Air-conditioner was making noise. I could not sleep, for at least 3-4 nights. After that instead of the room service, i figured out the solution and they implemented that.
reviews.title: Very Bad

reviews.text: The explanation of the hotel on that was that its building structure and they cannot change. Not at all customer focused.
reviews.title: Dirty Curtains in my Room, very rude and unfriendlie stuff at breakfast place

reviews.text: If you want to relax.. this hotel is not for you .. 100% avoid.
reviews.title: What can we say about this hotel ?

reviews.text: I was there for a convention, and the price for my old, smelly and dirty room was rocket high.
reviews.title: Very moderate

reviews.text: From my personal point of view i have seen much better NH Hotels, breakfast is in my opinion an insult to the rich dutch breakfast culture, as i asked for fresh and not convenience egg out of a tin, they told me. All other guests are eating it, so it must be good enough for you as well. It took myself two PERSONAL Complains at the front office, before they changed my total brown and and dirty curtain.
reviews.title: Not worth the tariff

description: Nestled among historic canals and quaint streets, the NH Utrecht provides guest with a centrally located yet peaceful urban retreat. Take a 5-minute walk to a national treasure of the Netherlands, the magnificent Dom Tower. The impressive Jaarbeurs Convention Center is also a quick walk from the hotel, affording an easy commute for guests in town on business. In addition to its 276 stylishly comfortable guests rooms, the NH Utrecht provides extensive meeting facilities comprised of 8 fully equipped, multi-functional conference rooms and 23 elegant executive boardrooms.
